intro: Gymnobalanus sprucei, commonly known as the white sand apple, is a small evergreen tree native to the coastal areas of southern China and northern Vietnam. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, spherical fruits containing one or two seeds. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
